body: Thanks @Leemoonsoo +1
Ah, yeap. sure.

I understand the situation. FYI, the binaries (except SparkR) are ready.
1. Download: https://www-us.apache.org/dist/spark/spark-2.4.0/
2. Maven: https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.spark/spark-core_2.12/2.4.0
3. PySpark: https://pypi.org/project/pyspark/2.4.0/

SparkR seems to be rejected by CRAN. But, in the worst case, it will become 2.4.1. I guess so.

Zeppelin depends on only (1), doesn't it?
That's correct, @dongjoon-hyun
There's already unit tests in `SparkRInterpreterTest.java`; what specifically do you suggest adding?
Thanks @felixcheung @zjffdu for review. Merge to master.
Thanks @felixcheung for review. Merge to master.
LGTM
Merge if no more comments
LGTM
yes, everything is out (except for the announcement)
Thank you guys!
Thanks @felixcheung for review. merge to master.
The unit test in `SparkRInterpreterTest` did not cover the error case. We need to add this kind of unit test.
What about merge?
Hey all ~ could this get in by any chance maybe?

cc @zjffdu @Leemoonsoo @prabhjyotsingh can you please merge this? 

Thank you.

Hi, All. It's announced finally.
http://spark.apache.org/news/spark-2-4-0-released.html
Thanks for everyone, the only remaining thing is to update `.travis.yml` to make sure the test pass again spark 2.4
Will merge this, if no more discussion.

CI is passed, will merge it if no more comments
Looking forward to seeing it merged and Zeppelin 0.9.0 released, Spark 2.4 fixes some very nasty bugs

This PR has been merged to branch-0.8. But somehow @asfgit didn't close the PR. @jolks Do you mind close this PR manually?

Thanks @Savalek for the contribution. I have a few questions.

1. What happens if a browser opens running notebook? Is it correct that `SEQUENTIAL_RUN_STATUS` message will not be received in this case. Can we handle this case?

2. How is it going to behave when notebook run is triggered by cron scheduler?
@Leemoonsoo Noted with thanks!

hi @egorklimov 
This PR is to help quickly close the interpreter process or to close the process more reliably? 
I found the zeppelin system running inside our company, When the interpreter process that sets the lifecycle timeout is automatically turned off, There are some interpreter processes that cannot be closed.

Hi @liuxunorg 
This PR just makes closing procedure faster: it places closing methods inside the threads, I don't think that it makes the whole closing procedure more reliable.

Maybe you should open an issue on this case?

Thanks @egorklimov for the improvement and attaching the benchmark result
LGTM
LGTM

Hello,
Is this PR going to be officially released soon as part of zeppelin 0.9.0? 
Thank you
It is merged to branch-0.8 and master branch. So yes it will be released in zeppelin 0.9.0, but I believe 0.8.1 will be released before zeppelin 0.9.0

thank you for the quick response!

does 0.8.1 have a release date?

thanks again

Merge to master, if no further comments.

Hi all, I'm using Zeppelin with the official Docker image and I'm still getting `java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: scala.tools.nsc.interpreter.ILoop.scala$tools$nsc$interpreter$ILoop$$loopPostInit()` when using Spark 2.4.0.
I've seen that on [docker store](https://store.docker.com/community/images/apache/zeppelin) the image has been updated for the last time 5 months ago. Could you please update it ? Or should I build the docker branch of the repo ?
Thank you
This fix is not released yet. This PR exactly fixes the problem you faced. This fix will be available in the next release of Zeppelin.
LGTM
LGTM
LGTM
ping @prabhjyotsingh
@Savalek Could you remove `ZP-25` from PR title ?
Thanks @monsieurp for the contribution, I left a few comments, otherwise LGTM
Time to merge? :innocent:
Thanks @zjffdu and @aka-demik for your comments. I've updated the PR accordingly.
Cool! Zeppelin takes off on the cloud :-)

One question, there is no point using this if I have a Spark clster on YARN (Cloudera/Hortonworks) right? The way I see it this is focusing on having The Spark coming with Zeppelin now be able to lunch in a cluster by using KB. Am I right?
I don't know why Jenkins failed. Let's try again.
argh! I give up... :(

> One question, there is no point using this if I have a Spark clster on YARN (Cloudera/Hortonworks) right? The way I see it this is focusing on having The Spark coming with Zeppelin now be able to lunch in a cluster by using KB. Am I right?

Right. I just pushed a commit fa36c18, and it allows user override `master` spark interpreter property. If `master` is not starting with `k8s://`, it does not configure Spark on Kubernetes. So I think this opens a possibility to connect other types of Spark cluster.
@monsieurp This might be flaky test, let me take a look at it.
this test failed? https://travis-ci.org/TinkoffCreditSystems/zeppelin/jobs/458386760
@felixcheung, yes.
@Savalek Could you resolve the conflicts ?

> Right. I just pushed a commit [fa36c18](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/commit/fa36c18e3788458aeff93492d99ef169022292a7), and it allows user override `master` spark interpreter property. If `master` is not starting with `k8s://`, it does not configure Spark on Kubernetes. So I think this opens a possibility to connect other types of Spark cluster.

Awesome! that is a great news. Just out of curiosity, does the Zeppelin server in KB must be the one which has acess to the Spark_Home or the Spark interpreter which is now a pod? (Just to manage which one should be a gateway in Cloudera cluster).
Thanks again 👍
Is there anything else I can improve?
@monsieurp Could you do a rebase and retrigger the travis build ?

> Awesome! that is a great news. Just out of curiosity, does the Zeppelin server in KB must be the one which has acess to the Spark_Home or the Spark interpreter which is now a pod? (Just to manage which one should be a gateway in Cloudera cluster).

Spark Interpreter is running inside of its own Pod. And Spark driver is running in Spark Interpreter. So Spark Interpreter Pod is the one, who need SPARK_HOME and access from/to Spark master/executors in your cluster.

> ping @prabhjyotsingh @r-kamath @zjffdu 

Any progress?

> LGTM @zjffdu 

Time to merge?
tbh, this seems rather minor. I'd leave this for others to comment.

Hi @felixcheung, yes that's it, the driver is compatible with all Neo4j version >= 3 (the last one is the 3.5). Actually in the documentation there is no mention about the minimum supported version. Do you want that I'll update it?
@sanjaydasgupta Hi, I missed this issue fully. So sorry. I think there was no objection about this issue. Correct?

perhaps we should have a min version compatible in the interpreter doc?
otherwise I think it's fine not to have tested version, supported version etc in doc since then we'd need to keep updating them

Tested on local.
LGTM
@Savalek Could you remove `ZP-25` from commit message ? And I see NPE in travis
Documentation updated!

Would be great to cut 0.9 release with this and all other great improvements that are currently only available in master. So more folks can take leverage of those features, and provide feedback sooner. 

Thank you!
I am working to fix the problem
can you check the failed tests?

ouch, thanks for fixing this. @prabhjyotsingh @jongyoul @Leemoonsoo 
this is important. I checked and don't think we have released with this commit https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/commit/affccab6ab3577a815e02bb4d88aa1e90d973d16 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-3781
BTW, is it ok only to change `package-lock.json` without `package.json`?

Travis tests for this PR failed [link](https://travis-ci.org/drod331/zeppelin/builds/461127589).
Dependency branch: `npm-run-all` --> `ps-tree` --> `event-stream` --> `flatmap-stream`.
I'm updated `npm-run-all` version to `4.1.5` ( this version not include`ps-tree`) and regenerate `package-lock.json'.
And travis checks is OK.
[Travis](https://travis-ci.org/Savalek/zeppelin/builds/461195255?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification) and [commit](https://github.com/Savalek/zeppelin/commit/3f7be1c44b4b0030572fb2c7c8b4eb149749a8c0).
Now there are two failing that I think are not related to this PR

Hi, I've made an integration of the oidc logout and have included a new profile (oidc) in order to build zeppelin with oidc related libs. I've started my work on branch-0.8 because master doesn't build with scala 2.11 at the moment. Would you like me to push my PR in this issue or do I have to create a new issue and ask if I can add a new profile for oidc ? I think it would be better to create a new one.

@jongyoul Honestly, I'm not sure.  I don't have a ton of experience with npm, I just knew that the dependency was breaking my build and changing package-lock.json locally worked for me.  It seems like the right answer here, thanks to @Savalek , might be bumping npm-run-all in package.json to a newer version, 4.1.5, which no longer uses the (grand)parent dependency of the offending library.
I found a bug, I'll keep you posted.
This build failed on travis-ci.org, but passed on travis-ci.com.  I'll investigate further and see what's going on.
@drod331, try to restart `2.3`, `2.7`, `2.11` tests. Sometimes it helps.
@felixcheung I'm back.

looks like you are blocked by https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3243

https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/461718800/log.txt

Hi @felixcheung , I added a test case. Please help me review the code, thank you!
Can you give me a ping when it's ready?
@zjffdu: Sorry for taking so long to respond. It's been a busy week. I've rebased my PR as requested.
merging if no more comment

@monsieurp I though about it again, and feel that providing 2 properties is very confusing to users. I think it is better to give one property (zeppelin.jdbc.maxRows) what is user care about. `zeppelin.jdbc.rowsFetchSize` is internal property that zeppelin should configure to users. Here's one post explain the difference between `setFetchSize` and `setMaxRows` 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32399546/what-is-the-difference-between-statement-setmaxrows-vs-statement-setfetchsize-in?lq=1
